Risk & Continuity Manager - VIC/ NSW

Company Name Interactive Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

At Interactive we pride ourselves on having a great work culture and providing the best customer experience in the industry. That's how we've achieved the title of the largest privately-owned IT Company in Australia and have also been named in BRW's top 20 best places to work!

The role?
You will be required to develop, maintain and improve the Risk Management framework and ensure Interactive’s Business Continuity program is current, regularly exercised and in line with best practice.

As our SME for Risk Management and Business Continuity, some of your responsibilities will include:
  • Further develop the Risk Management framework, procedures and policies in line with Best Practice;
  • Oversee risk assessments and general governance of corporate risks;
  • Chair monthly cross-functional risk meetings;
  • Maintain Crisis Management and Business Continuity Plan;
  • Align Business Continuity planning with ISO 22301.
To be successful, you will ideally have:
  • Familiarity with ISO 31001 Risk Management standard and framework;
  • Exposure to managing risks within a formal framework;
  • Experience documenting Business Impact Analysis and Business Continuity plans;
  • Competent managing cross-functional teams to achieve tangible outcomes;
  • CRISC or equivalent Risk qualification is preferred.
You will naturally have excellent written and verbal skills, be highly organised, have strong attention to detail and problem solving skills. For the right person, we are open to Sydney or Melbourne location. Please apply following the link below to express interest.

We pride ourselves on valuing everyone’s differences and embracing diversity. To continue to drive our success we are committed to never discriminating based on race, colour, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

  • Computer Networking

823649893:
[

Test Coach and Lead Tester

Company Name Quest Software Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 299 views

Job description

Your mission

As our Agile Test Coach & Lead Tester, you will be responsible for leading and coaching the practice of testing within our Melbourne-based Engineering team. Help us build the “Whole Test Team Approach”.

\xa0

You will also interact with other engineers across our worldwide teams, as we build our SaaS monitoring solution using agile development practices in a microservices architecture. You will help us to mature our testing capability across the entire solution, evolving our practices with a focus on making sure that the highest level of quality is delivered to our customers.


How you’ll spend your time

You can expect plenty of variety, but some examples of how you’ll be spending your time in this role include:

\xa0

  • Championing our evolving ways of testing, bringing Agile practices and DevOps to life, focusing on delivering value and quality early.
  • Coaching developers to learn more about good testing and applying these ideas in their daily work.
  • Coaching testers in our preferred ways of testing and ensuring the right mix of exploratory testing and automation in the context of each team.
  • Leading from the front by performing excellent exploratory testing and implementing automated API checks as part of your day-to-day work.
  • Collaborating with other leaders to verify that good testing practices are followed across the delivery teams.
  • Generating ideas to uplift quality, efficiency and effectiveness across the teams.
  • Working with the Director of Software Craft to ensure consistent messaging of our preferred approaches to testing across the teams.

What you need to fit the bill

Here’s what you need to demonstrate for us to believe you could be the right person for this role:

\xa0

  • You have previous experience leading & coaching testing or other software delivery teams.
  • You possess a strong desire to advocate for great testing within development teams (and not just performed by testers).
  • You have a strong understanding & preference for Agile ways of working..
  • You love spreading the good word on ways to improve testing and the software delivery processes.
  • Your natural inclination is towards the principles of context-driven testing and a desire to see exploratory testing as the approach of choice across our delivery teams, and you have genuine experience of testing in accordance with these principles in a commercial environment.
  • You understand the challenges of testing in a microservices architecture and have experience of implementing testing strategies in such an environment (e.g. consumer-driven contract testing).
  • You enjoy working with a broad range of stakeholders and peers across timezones, and are an effective communicator in such an environment.
  • You help the team and stakeholders figure out how they are testing, and if they are testing enough.
  • You have a clear understanding of where automation adds value (and where it doesn’t) and can assist with both direction & implementation tasks in this area.
  • You show passion for excellence and continuous improvement.
  • We love people who love to share their knowledge, so any demonstrated involvement in or contribution to the broader testing community (e.g. presenting at conferences and meetups, writing articles/blogs on testing) will be a big plus.

\xa0

Benefits\xa0should note:

\xa0

  • Flexible working conditions
  • Dedicated time for professional development (10% time, conference attendance, etc.)
  • Opportunities for international travel

Job description

We are currently looking for an experienced full-time Personal Assistant to join the team in our Melbourne office. For the right candidate this role could be the start of a very rewarding career where you not only support the Partnership group but also contribute to the success of the business.

Your core responsibilities will include:

  • Day to day administrative support for 6 Partners
  • Diary management
  • Travel bookings, accommodation and transfers
  • Document preparation and minutes for Partner meetings
  • Liaise with external stakeholders and referral partners on behalf of the Partnership
  • Other ad hoc administrative tasks and special projects

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Experience in dealing with a multitude of stakeholders and building and maintaining these relationships
  • Exemplary IT skills and the ability to learn new programs quickly
  • An aptitude for process improvement
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar support role
  • A qualification in business administration or similar will be highly regarded

If you are successful in this position we offer you an extensive learning and development program that is tailored to suit your role, a friendly and engaging culture and the opportunity to get better acquainted with your colleagues at our team building events. We also offer an opportunity to be involved in project teams and work on helping the business achieve key strategic and business goals.

If you are looking for a new opportunity that will build on your current skills then this is the role for you. Please send through your cover letter and CV to careersmelbourne@worrells.net.au.

Business Relationship Manager

Company Name Bank of Queensland Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join ASX Top 100 Finance Leader – Australia’s Most Loved Bank!
  • Suit experienced, results driven Business Relationship Manager looking to join a high performing team
  • Flexible workplace & Collaborative team – Melbourne Location
  • Awarded Best Relationship Business Bank 2017 at the industry’s premier Business Banking Awards hosted by RFi Group


About Us

Join one of Australia's top 100 listed companies where our vision is to create Australia’s Most Loved Bank! BOQ Business are passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and competitive environment.

We support a flexible workplace and have a collaborative team environment. You will be part of a professional team in Brisbane and gain exposure to a diverse portfolio of clients and products.

BOQ Business looks after the Banks Commercial Lending, Equipment Finance, Specialist Lending, Trade and Financial Markets. The client relationships are held across many segments which include Branches, Brokers, Business Banking, Corporate, Property and Agribusiness and are serviced by teams throughout Australia. BOQ Business is recognised for our excellence in Relationship Banking and have recently received awards from the AB&F as well as East & Partners.

Your New Role

Working closely with the Manager Relationship Banking, this role requires an experienced Business Relationship Manager to on-board, retain and manage a portfolio of mid-market and SME clients. Further, you will be responsible in achieving consistent growth results, ensuring year-on-year (YOY) growth is achieved across your client portfolio, via:
  • Writing new to bank credit submissions introduced by BDM’s and/or self-sourced
  • Working with BDMs on originating, winning and settling new to bank prospects
  • Achieving lending growth, revenue and cross-sell targets, ensuring sustainable and profitable growth
  • Professionally manage client relationships, ensuring retention and advocacy is achieved with existing quality customers
  • Provide exceptional leadership support, guidance and coaching to the Business Relationship Officer


About You

You are distinguished from your peers due to your well-developed relationship management experience and passion for exceeding client expectations. Further, you will demonstrate previous leadership experience and a background in commercial banking. Your impressive track record will speak for itself. You will demonstrate a professional approach at all times, be able to communicate strongly and openly to both individuals and groups, think outside the square and have exceptional stakeholder engagement capability. Above all else, you will be a self-directed, motivated team player who is passionate about providing a better client experience.

Be Part Of The Journey With BOQ And Enjoy
  • Discounted financial products
  • Salary packaging options
  • Purchase annual leave
  • BUPA Corporate Plan
  • Gym discounts and much more!


How To Apply

The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply

BOQ is a member of the Australian Bankers’ Association and has subscribed to the Conduct Background Check Protocol (Protocol). Under the Protocol, from 1 October 2017, BOQ will contact any previous employer/s who are also part of this association to provide a Conduct Check of any potential employee.

If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

To apply for this role please follow the links.

834746163:
[

Compliance Manager

Company Name Bupa Australia & New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 96 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are a world leading Health & Care organisation with over 22,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. In Australia, we help to take care of people through our leading health insurance services as well as providing a personalised approach to care through our modern Dental clinic network, our Bupa Optical stores, Bupa Medical Visa services and over 70 Bupa Aged Care Homes. Bupa Therapy, along with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.

At Bupa our people are transforming and making a difference in the world of health & care.


About the opportunity


The Compliance Manager is accountable for the promotion and implementation of the Compliance Framework in the Bupa Australian and New Zealand Business. The role is responsible for delivering a robust compliance framework that meets the needs of the business as well as ensuring the business meets all its Compliance obligations. Working with Directors and other Compliance Managers, this is a brilliant opportunity to further your risk and compliance career and work with a global organisation that cares for its customers.


Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


  • Ensuring the ANZbusiness is aware of its compliance obligations and oversees the management of compliance risk and incidents;
  • Assist the business to identify and understand regulatory obligations and associated risks;
  • Oversee and challenge the business ensuring controls are in place to manage compliance risk;
  • Contribute to annual planning processes, including identification of emerging compliance risks, weaknesses in controls, and engagement of business leads;
  • Monitor regulatory change and support the business with understanding any emerging new or changed change obligations;
  • Work with the Legal and Government Relations teams to ensure the business obtains any required legal advice and understands government policy directions;
  • Provide input and support to the Director of Compliance and Regulation with a view of overall compliance risk across Bupa A&NZ;
  • Prepare management information to Risk Committees and management to assist them with understanding compliance risk position;
  • Work with the business to develop and monitor compliance and customer outcomes KRIs to highlight any emerging issues; and
  • Provide training as and when required to the broader business through workshops and written communications.

\xa0

Your Background

\xa0

With a strong professional and commercial career to date in risk and compliance roles in complex environments, you will ideally have:

  • 8+ years’ experience in similar compliance, regulatory or assurance roles;
  • Strong knowledge of commercial compliance obligations such as the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth), Competition and Consumer Act 2010 (Cth). Knowledge of Aged Care or Health Services regulation highly regarded but not mandatory;
  • Strong analytical skills;
  • Extensive experience in regulatory breach reporting requirements and related management and remediation;
  • Appropriate knowledge and experience to confidently interact with relevant business leaders;
  • Comprehensive compliance experience in Australia or New Zealand relevant to Bupa's activities; and
  • Experience in presenting to senior management teams.


Join us


Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding workplace, and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences, encouraging innovation, delivering award winning benefits to our employees and being involved with our communities.

Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.


Find the purpose in your career!

  • Customer Services
